required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Shark Screw® - Hand- and Foot Surgery Study
clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective Study on the Use of a Human Bone Graft (Shark Screw®) in Hand- and Foot Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: This observational study aims to determine the efficacy and safety of the Shark Screw® transplant for osteotomy and arthrodesis in hand and foot surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: The Shark Screw® transplant (surgebright GmbH) is a human cortical bone allograft for osteosynthesis and can replace metal or bioabsorbable devices in various procedures. In total, the clinical records from 32 patients who had undergone surgical procedure at the hand or foot between October 2016 and January 2018 with the use of a Shark Screw® transplant for joint arthrodesis or for the stabilization of osteotomies serve as data sources for this study. The aim of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of the Shark Screw® transplant in hand and foot surgery by analyzing the recovery, wound and bone healing process.

primary_outcome.description: Absence of radiolucent lines around the transplant in the x-ray

The visual analogue scale (VAS) is a vertical line, 10 centimeters (100 mm) in length, anchored by 2 verbal descriptors, one for each symptom extremes (0mm = no pain - 100mm = worst imaginable pain). A higher score indicates more pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of postoperative complication and soft tissue irritation
secondary_outcome.description: Did wound healing disorder or soft tissue irritation occur?
Was a surgical revision done postoperatively?
Based on x-rays or MRI: Is a postoperative pseudarthrosis visible?
How long did the patient take analgesics after surgery?

secondary_outcome.measure: Cellular contact to the recipient bone
secondary_outcome.description: Absence of sclerosis around the transplant in the x-ray

secondary_outcome.measure: Resorptive processes in the recipient bone
secondary_outcome.description: Absence of cystic lucency in the x-ray

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of cracking or loosening of the screw
secondary_outcome.description: Based on x-rays: Is a loosening or cracking of the screw visible?
Patient satisfaction was classified as "very satisfied", "satisfied" and "not satisfied"

intervention.description: Application of a Shark Screw® transplant for osteosynthesis or arthrodesis in hand- or foot surgery

study_pop.textblock: patients who underwent hand- or foot surgery with the application of a Shark Screw® transplant

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Application of the human bone graft Shark Screw® in a Hand- or Foot surgical procedure between October 2016 and January 2018
- Data from at least 1 follow-up examination after surgery around the 6th post-operative week or other information about the health status of the patient in the first 6 post-operative weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- not enough data for an objective analysis
